channel.title: OOP project
channel.description:
I started a little project on my free times to practice OOP as much as possible. There is inheritance and polymorphism included, so here it is:
[ul][*]Dropbox: [url=https://www.dropbox.com/sh/nvo2hoe8p2j7wto/LWjvZtsqyr]https://www.dropbox.com/sh/nvo2hoe8p2j7wto/LWjvZtsqyr[/url] [*]Github: [url=https://github.com/Hashes/Thematics]https://github.com/Hashes/Thematics[/url][/ul]
If you have any comments or suggestions, feel free to post below :)

item.title: OOP project
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

Tree:

You have much to learn padawan.

Yea, I made Java for 1 year before with RSPS, but never considered doing OOP not related with this. I learned a lot since then.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

You have much to learn padawan.

item.title: OOP project
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

I work on this about 10 minutes per day and it’s most of the time thinking on how I can structure it. I read about OOP and various other things, try to think how it can grow and etc. I don’t expect it to be big and all what’s coming with it, but it practices me.

Read full topic

item.title: OOP project
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Why are you getting and setting a combat instance in the player object?

the entire project seems to have no real structure or substance so I don’t know what advice you could hope to acquire from this?

Read full topic
